results.name: wordpress-mysql/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-1], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not functioning because the expected pod (mysql-1) is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs mysql-1`.
3. Verify readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure pod dependencies are running.
5. Restart pod if necessary.

results.name: wordpress-mysql/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-79dcbfb9d5-hfh42 Pod/wordpress-79dcbfb9d5-qm9gx Pod/wordpress-79dcbfb9d5-mrn5v], expected 3

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected 3 pods are not in a ready state.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs [pod-name]`.
3. Ensure pods are healthy and resolve any issues.
4. Verify readiness probes are correctly configured.

results.name: wordpress-mysql/wordpress-79dcbfb9d5-hfh42

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.

results.name: wordpress-mysql/mysql-1

error.Text:
Readiness probe failed: mysqladmin: connect to server at 'localhost' failed
error: 'Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)'
Check that mysqld is running and that the socket: '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' exists!

results.details:
Error: The Kubernetes readiness probe failed because it can't connect to the MySQL server via the specified socket.

Solution: 
1. Ensure MySQL is running: `systemctl status mysql`.
2. Verify the socket file exists: `ls /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock`.
3. Restart MySQL: `systemctl restart mysql`.
